alert.note: Alert for Eastern San Juan Mountains Above 10000 Ft; Eastern Sawatch Mountains above 11000 Ft; Elkhead and Park Mountains; Flat Tops; Gore and Elk Mountains, Central Mountain Valleys; Grand and Battlement Mesas; La Garita Mountains Above 10000 Ft; Northwestern San Juan Mountains; South and Southeast Grand, West Central and Southwest Boulder, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Summit, North and West Park Counties Above 9000 Feet; Southwest San Juan Mountains; Uncompahgre Plateau, Dallas Divide; West Elk and Sawatch Mountains; West Jackson and West Grand Counties Above 9000 Feet; Western Chaffee County Between 9000 and 11000 Ft; Western Mosquito Range, East Lake County Above 11000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Avalanche Watch issued December 27 at 6:04AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: THE FOLLOWING MESSAGE IS TRANSMITTED AT THE REQUEST OF THE COLORADO AVALANCHE INFORMATION CENTER. * WHAT...Avalanche Watch * WHERE... CAIC Forecast Zones: Steamboat and Flat Tops, Vail and Summit County, Sawatch, Aspen, Gunnison, Grand Mesa, North San Juan, and South San Juan zones * WHEN... Begin Monday December 27 At 6:00AM Expires Tuesday December 28 at 8:00AM * IMPACTS... Widespread dangerous conditions are expected across large portions of Colorado on Monday night and Tuesday due to snowfall and strong winds. Large natural and human triggered avalanches are likely. * PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Travel in avalanche terrain is not recommended in these areas on Monday night through at least Tuesday. Go to www.colorado.gov/avalanche for the most up-to-date information. Cooperstein
